website_summaries.verdict: An economy buy that will get you almost everything you need for less than half the price of more premium models.
pros: Delivers high-quality performance that rivals that of most of its higher-priced competitors
Easy to stow away after use
cons: Doesn't have the bells and whistles as some of the more expensive models on our list

website_summaries.verdict: This treadmill comes with some quality and functional concerns, but it also has a nice feature set that makes it worth a look.
pros: Offers 12 preset programs so you can add variety to your fitness regimen
Has very slow speeds for beginners, yet can achieve speeds up to 10 miles per hour for experienced users
You can monitor your pulse, distance traveled, calories burned, and more from the large display
cons: Some treadmills displayed error codes and had various functional issues
Treadmill is large, even when folded

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm, no negatives.
customer_reviews.text: I run 5-9 miles 4 times a week on this. I bought it because it was cheaper, had good reviews. I didnt want to spend $600+ to find out I am really not into it. I've been using it for the last few months. I enjoy it, and do not have negative feedback at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Beaker

customer_reviews.title: Be really careful when folding it
customer_reviews.text: The product works great but it seems to have a big flaw in the design, on the picture you can see whenever you fold it, it’s barely secure by piece of metal that if you move the treadmill while folded, it will unfold very easily and could cause severe damage to the person moving it. Also, the wheel design it’s very poor since I couldn’t find a way to move it easily using the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: Great treadmill
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. Assembly was easy, took me about 20 minutes. My only complaint is that I wish it was a bit wider, but I guess I'm just used to the gym treadmills. It's not huge, so if you are looking for a space saver-this is it. I bought this one instead of Amazon's pick since the only guy that purchased and reviewed this actually left a good review.
customer_reviews.author: Stefano T.

customer_reviews.title: Error Code 4 after 1 hour of use.  Now won’t work.
customer_reviews.text: The box package came was ripped and not secure. Setup was easy but after walking 1 hour on treadmill an error code 4 displayed and whole treadmill stopped working. 1 Star is for initial impression of product. Now I have to go through time and trouble to return or get fixed/replaced. This shouldn’t happen right out of box. Hopefully, I can come back and give better review for how this problem is handled.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: A COMPLETE WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: I also received a non working treadmill. E2 message saying belt was not aligned properly. I am returning unit which is not easy to put back in box and tape up the box! Very much disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: D Hill

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to run
customer_reviews.text: Had good reviews. Highly disappointed. Only weigh 190 and I can’t run on this thing. The entire belt portion basically skips a beat whenever I step on it or even try to run at any speed and I almost fall off. I’ve had multiple people try this of various weights and they experienced the same thing. You have to catch yourself from falling off. Can’t even run on a treadmill which is its only purpose. Not sure if this is just mine or if it the product in general. Will be returning. And yes I put it together properly
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Needs lubricant
customer_reviews.text: Great treadmill without question. However, the silicon lubricant should come with it. The treadmill needs to be lubed every 40 hrs and the silicon gel needed is not available locally. Thank god for amazon prime.
customer_reviews.author: carol dunlop

customer_reviews.title: Error code E5, xterra tr150 folding treadmill
customer_reviews.text: Less than 3 months of using this new treadmill I'm receiving error code E5. Treadmill stops after few seconds. If you need good treadmill you need to spend more money!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Eden

customer_reviews.title: Should have known - same as reviews - Did not work - E5 Error
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say here. I was excited to receive this, but then disappointed when, after following the instructions carefully and assembling everything (not much to assemble), we plugged it in and were going to try it out only to get an E5 error repeatedly. Tried a few different things to try to get the error message to go away but it never did. Treadmill did not run even a single time. The return process also a bit of a headache with UPS and Amazon giving me different information.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer G.

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I had this treadmill for less than a year. I used it 5 days/week for walking. I did all the required maintenance. The treadmill stopped working -both the motor and dashboard are messed up. I contacted Xterra who said since I was past the 3 month warranty period there was nothing they could do about it. Fortunately Amazon is working with me for a partial resolution but I will never purchase another Xterra product. Waste of money!!
customer_reviews.author: andrea waterhouse

customer_reviews.title: Just Do It
customer_reviews.text: If you know you need to walk/jog but you are either scared of or grossed out by your local gym, stop wasting money on that membership and just get this. It will do the job. It’s easy to assemble and you can finally workout without worrying about germs or judgement. Just do it. Get one. You need it.
customer_reviews.author: DeeAnna

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Assembled today and used for no more than 20 minutes and trouble code e8 popped up. E8 is not listed in the trouble shoot codes so have to contact tech support. Not happy, not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Dorsey

customer_reviews.title: USELESS
customer_reviews.text: A NICE SIDE COMPACT THREADMILL. WHEN I PUT IT TOGETHER, I PLUGGED IN AND TURN IT ON. THE THREADMILL BELT STARTED TURNING AT FULL SPEED, WITH AN ERROR CODE E4.I PRESS THE STOP BUTTON, BUT IT DID'NT STOP I HAD TO UNPLUGED IT. I READ THE TOUBLESHOOT SECTION IN THE MANUAL. IT SAID LOOSE WIRE OR MOTOR WIRED WRONG. HAD TO REMOVE COVER AND SHAKE THE WIRES.. THEN IT WORKED FOR TWO WEEKS UNTIL THE SAME PROBLAM STARTED AGAIN. I SPOKE TO A TECH. TECH SAID IT COULD BE THE MOTHERBROAD, THEY DID,NT HAVE ANY ON HAND, IWOULD HAVE TO WAIT. CALLED AMAZON AND SEND IT BACK.
customer_reviews.author: H. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: MAJOR SAFETY ISSUE
customer_reviews.text: The latch that holds the running area folded is too small to handle the weight. After folding this and attempting to roll it a few inches, the latch came unhooked the running area fell into my face, breaking the bridge of my nose. The design is flawed. I’m just so lucky it didn’t fall onto one of the children or dogs in the household, has enough weight to have killed them.
customer_reviews.author: Sayyesinsf

customer_reviews.title: Garbage and Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: This trash continues to stay Lube. When you do live the machine and try to reset it still doesn’t work. The lube display will only allow you to use it for 30 minutes without abruptly stopping nearly throwing you off the machine. The belt always slips to one side and makes an awful noise. What a waste of my money I’m so UPSET that I wasted my money. You can never get anyone one the line from customer service, even when you leave a message no one calls back. DO NOT buy this GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.author: Leara

customer_reviews.title: Long term questionability
customer_reviews.text: So I want to start by saying this treadmill really helped me get thru quarantine. I was putting on weight and becoming apathetic. This treadmill was an affordable and essential part of my quarantine boost. Was relatively easy to put together and is very small and folds up nicely. The negative-This treadmill is pretty noisy right from the start, however over time it's become borderline unusable due to its volume. Anytime I put this over 7.5 speed, it starts squeaking and whining at a volume that is distracting and noticable to neighbors. I've done the lubrication and maintenance, but nothing has helped. Not a bad purchase for a few months, but doesn't seem to have staying power.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Lube message won’t clear off/ not running properly
customer_reviews.text: The treadmill came with a dent in it. Which didn’t not affect the way it ran at all. However, now it has reached the time frame of hours that it needed to be lubricated. I followed all instructions and the lube message will not clear from the screen. And the treadmill still works but I’ve noticed I’m now running it at a higher speed to get a workout in that ever before. It’s like it’s not running as fast as it used to be. Given the choice to redo my purchase I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Brandie Henson

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, easy to assemble, no damage
customer_reviews.text: The treadmill came in 2 days. Packaging A+ . No damage to it whatsoever. I am 5’6 and the handles sit comfortably at my hips. Shoe size 8.5 (tried to show how wide the band is). My band is nicely centered but it is definitely adjustable if it should move left or right. I like all of the speeds but I am not that fast of a runner. I joggish at 6.3 setting and run MY fastest at setting 7. It goes up to 9 which I’ll probably never use haha.
customer_reviews.author: Almira

customer_reviews.title: This treadmill is not a keeper
customer_reviews.text: When i got this treadmill i was so excited my first week using this treadmill was ok but then after a week i start hearing this load noise even when i would want to walk on it this treadmill was very loud so i thought i should oil the treadmill i did and the noise stopped but then here we go again 3 day's later the same loud noise lol it's horrible i also purchased insurance on it but what good would that do if you halft to fix stuff yourself so i wasted money on this treadmill but im sure it'll be ok in the drop off donation pile at the good will
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Michell Life

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this machine because it was space saver; however, it is high maintenance. It consistently makes a loud, squeaky noise when I use it. My husband has to adjust the treads every week. The only other thing that quiets the machine is to keep both hands on the handles. At times, I want to run on the treadmill and not hold on to the handles. The noise it makes does not make this possible. Think twice before purchasing this treadmill. I wish I had not purchased this machine.
customer_reviews.author: T. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Lube msg won't go off. I've lubed it and followed instructions in the manual to hold down "program" for three seconds to make lube msg go away. It's blocking the whole screen with "LUBE" I can see many others have this issue because I'm reading in the q & a here. Now it isn't running at the right speeds. I have put less than 10 hrs WALKING on this treadmill. It will say I'm going 5.7 mph but I'm really Going around 3
customer_reviews.author: Angieyay

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I did not this product it broke on the second week.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clearing the LUBE Error
customer_reviews.text: I had the same issue as others where the LUBE error wouldn't clear after holding the Program button in for 3 seconds, as the sticker recommends. I called customer support and found the fix. Hold in the Enter key for a few seconds, then pull out the red safety key, replace the red safety key, and then release the Enter key. That should do it! On a whole I love this little treadmill, especially given its price. It seems to be doing the job!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, assembled quickly and easily, doesn’t work. No error signs or anything, simply does not turn on. I’ll update if anything changes, but as of now it is absolute garbage and a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could return it
customer_reviews.text: Looks great but very cheap. The alignment has never been right from the day I bought it. I wish I could return it. I am only 120 pounds and it makes so much noise .
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Information screen messing up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this treadmill so I would have a way to continue running through the fall and winter without going outside in the cold. It gets the job done. My main problem with this is that after having it for only about a month or so, the pixels on the information screen are starting to screw up. They're bleeding down into the information displaying calories, miles run/walked, etc. (By the way, calories burned is INCREDIBLY overestimated and miles are greatly underestimated). I'm concerned that this problem will get worse as time goes on and will render the screen useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Xterra does not work. Amazon does not support
customer_reviews.text: The product worked for one week. After that it required oil on the belt and all kinds of error codes appeared. Contacted Amazon and they contacted the manufacturer to reset the codes. After the second week it stopped working completely. Contacted Amazon again and they contacted manufacturer to establish that it needs a new motor and that they will send technician to replace it. Technician never showed up. Call Amazon again and they did not want to accept return. So, they contacted manufacturer again and they said all they can do is send technician again. It has been over two months. This is a scam from Amazon and from Xterra. Do not buy any xterra products on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: Lube message
customer_reviews.text: For all who are frustrated with Lube message ... Press enter for 3 seconds
customer_reviews.author: Sra

customer_reviews.title: Lube Warning
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in December 2018. It wasn't the best treadmill, nor was it the worst - it did its job. However, after about three months of ownership, this treadmill has the words "Lube" on it dictating that I put more lube on it. Though, I have already put a good bit more lube on it twice now and have followed the instructions to reset it the word "Lube" will not go away. I would like to return this product and get my money back since it is defective. I recommend not purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: John Q. Public

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.text: Loved it when it was working. I received this treadmill on June 15th, 2020 and used it 3-4 time a week. Today is July 27th, 2020 and the screen malfunctions already. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Pui(Sophia)

customer_reviews.title: awesome value
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill will meet most runners needs and do so on a budget. The only people who may have issues are those who are looking for speeds past 10 mph but other than that I would think everyone would be pleasantly surprised by the quality for the price. I use mine to run for 20-30 minutes 6 days a week and I love it. Beats running outside in Iowa winters.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer/Reporter

customer_reviews.title: Screen is malfunctioning
customer_reviews.text: It’s been less than a month and the screen is already malfunctioning. And a product this large is such a hassle to return or exchange. Ughhh.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this treadmill as a birthday gift for my sister who lives in a small condo. My son assembled it for her as I handed him the washers and screws. He said it was easy to assemble; only took him 30 minutes including unpacking the product. My sister really likes the treadmill so far! She uses it almost everyday. She says it feels sturdy and she likes the variety of choices for workout routines. As it has been less than 3-weeks since she received the treadmill, I will update the review if there are any significant changes in it's quality or performance in the future. I also bought a 2-year extended warranty for this product.
customer_reviews.author: EvaYvonne

customer_reviews.title: Well made, woth the price.
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill replaced a 19 year old Pro Form treadmill that finally wore out it's motor, but proved to be faithful and rugged to the end. I did a lot of research for the replacement. Though somewhat smaller than the Pro Form, this machine's components appear to be as sturdy, and of similar build quality but nearly at less than half the price. It is truly well packaged, and easy to assemble. At my age I intend to limit my usage to walking limits, so the machine might very well outlast me.
customer_reviews.author: justmythoughts

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: The extra large 70 pound box with treadmill inside arrived on time. It took a bit of effort to get into the house since I did not have any help and there was only one shipping strap to grab onto. Good instructions made it easy to assemble. Recommend putting the box near the place where the treadmill will be located. If you open the box the right way, you can slide the components over and assemble in place. Easy to use and keep me active even when the weather does not allow me to take a walk around town.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Mom

customer_reviews.title: Low quality treadmill. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Low quality product. It started making noise in the first weeks of usage. And the display is not working as expected. When changing the speed, it becomes buggy.
customer_reviews.author: gil.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Stops when the speed changes, returned on the 1 week mark. Save your box and all the packaging just in case!
customer_reviews.author: nzx6rk

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill has pros and cons. The two cons in my opinion are that it is pretty noisy and there is really no incline. I agree with another reviewer who said it shouldn’t be advertised as having one. The machine itself is quiet but it get really creaky and squeaky whenever someone is on it. The pros are that it is otherwise what I had been wanting. It works well, assembly was quick, it’s narrow but not too narrow, and I can use it for walking and running. It gets up to a nice speed and is easy to use. I always lean toward simple is best, and I like the simplicity of this treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsi Sigurdson

customer_reviews.title: Great Treadmill!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Perfect size for an apartment. It is the perfect exercise equipment for me (i am currently on Weight Watchers and have lost 50lbs). I purchased the installation service. That was the best thing I could have done. The service provider was awesome. Thank you Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: ShoeShopper4Life

customer_reviews.title: Nice and cheap treadmill
customer_reviews.text: So this is a treadmill. It is useful for running and it serves its purpose well and has held up quite nicely. However, there are some things that I would like to point out that I'm not a fan. When setting up, the wire connection things were just superglued together, which to me, made it seem cheaply made, as well as the piece to fold the treadmill up is just one bar knob thing welded on. Also, the belt which is supposedly 'layered' is very, very thin and probably not shock absorbing. So hopefully these will not cause it to have a short lifespan, but they are a concern for me in terms of longevity for the future.
customer_reviews.author: Pineappleroses

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful construction, easy assembly, great price for walking!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble for this 73 yo retired grandmother. It took no longer than 20 minutes and I did it myself. They even give you the screwdriver. Now I’m back to walking happily every day. It has no bells and whistles that I don’t need and that I can’t understand how to run. It flips up easily if I want that, but I usually leave it down. It is well cushioned for my bad knee. And the price....I’m SO happy I didn’t purchase the $843 modal that was offered locally. Love this treadmill!
customer_reviews.author: SarahD

customer_reviews.title: This is unusable, very disappointed. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot operate this in my house because it keeps tripping off the circuit breakers. Its marked as 9A but it cannot even be on a 20A dedicated circuit. I don't know what joke 2000+ people who gave glowing reviews are on about....this is a fake unusable item for a regular household.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Silva

customer_reviews.title: Great treadmill
customer_reviews.text: I am 64 female I put it together by myself was so easy!!! Put my iPad on it went to YouTube where they have virtual walking trails and took off! Love it. What a buy!
customer_reviews.author: flo

customer_reviews.title: This treadmill is great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this treadmill so I have only used it a couple times. I am a heavy set, 5'6" woman and appreciate that it's sturdy. I jogged at a 5 (speed) with no issues. This treadmill is great for the price! Negatives: The handlebars placement -they are at the same height as my hands so I have punched them a few times. The belt is a little narrow and loose, however I think it will flatten with use. There is not place for a water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Standard basic treadmill
customer_reviews.text: The folding doesn’t feel too secure. So we left it unfolded. This treadmill is great if you need basic functions for treadmill (ie. Just increase the speed). Incline levels are manually set. Also, if this is your first home treadmill, do not think / expect that this is like the ones at the gym. This is not a commercial style treadmill. The belt is a lot smaller. Overall, for me it suits its purpose. For the price, it’s a great buy. However, slightly disappointed about the folding mechanism. As such I can only give a 4 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: JanL

customer_reviews.title: After three months it stopped working.  Fixed it. Works fine a year later.
customer_reviews.text: I use the treadmill three times a week. I have not complaints. When it stopped working and presented the code, can't remember which, for the key, we unscrewed the front plate (screws are on the back) and found the port that the key should inter had fallen off. We pushed it back in and the machine worked fine for a week, then stopped working again. Same issue. Glue the port in place on the underside of the front plate to keep from having it happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Cucher

customer_reviews.title: For this price this thing is a killer!
customer_reviews.text: got it yesterday and I am still speechless! This is nothing that I have expected... But this price I was thinking it’s gonna be a little flimsy thing that will do a little bit of exercise. This treadmill is solid, with all the bells and whistle‘s that I did not expect at all! It is quiet and runs very smoothly. Very easy to change speed and it has a safety key. I am definitely in love with it. If something unexpected happens I will definitely update.
customer_reviews.author: Marina M

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not good enough
customer_reviews.text: Purchased just over 2yrs ago. It wasn't hard to assemble. We have it in the basement and never folded it up, so I can't comment on related issues I saw in other review. Good budget friendly piece of equipment. BUT it literally dies on me couple weeks ago. The machine kept on beeping and the screen kept flashing. No error code. According to the tech support on the phone, most likely the controller board is gone! Really, for just over 2 yr. Well, parts are all in backorder till December, and frankly I don't know if I want to spend that kink of money to get replacement parts and don't know how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Sam C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for walking
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my dad because he was not able to go to the GYM and was not walking around his neighborhood because of the heat and from what I can tell he thinks it's great. I set it up for him and it was super easy to set up. I used it a few times to walk, jog and did some running. I personally would want a little larger tread area if I was running on this every day but my dad has been using it for walking and loves it. He has told me it's exactly what he needs.
customer_reviews.author: Alex E. Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Good Value Here
customer_reviews.text: Simple review that I will follow up on. I weigh 325 pounds and needed to get moving. I been using this 30-45 minutes a day. Works great so far. Easy to put together. The deck was longer then I anticipated. Wish it were a few inches wider but it's still wide enough. Check back for my follow up in a month or 2.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Fast and very helpful adjustment service.
customer_reviews.text: My last treadmill died after 26 years. I purchased this Xterra TR150 and am delighted. It is very well built, has all the buttons I need, and it's very quiet. I had a minor issue with an occasional noise from the belt. I called customer service and talked to Jonathan. He was knowledgeable and very helpful. He helped me make a minor adjustment and all is good. Jonathan is a credit to the company. Thanks. Daniel C. Ellis Attorney at Law
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E.

customer_reviews.title: Lube Message won’t go away, but figured it out.
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with the product. However, If anyone gets the lube message please do the following: After applying the lube underneath the belt, Press the “ENTER” button for three seconds to reset. I am giving 4 stars and not 5 because the Manuel I retrieved online says to press “PROGRAM” button for 3 seconds to reset which is incorrect. I had to look through the reviews made by other customers to get the right answer. Besides this minor setback, it is worth the money and a great purchase especially during these COVID times. Stay safe y’all.
customer_reviews.author: joby

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different one in person
customer_reviews.text: This was not only cheap. The manual incline is in the back and barely raises it, plus it isn't realistic to expect an older lady to be able to do it. The return was a TOTAL disaster with nothing but scheduling disasters and it took me literally 10 calls to finally get it picked up. Ended up buying a better one at a store for a little more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely hate treadmills and prefer to run outside. I bought this in March after the pandemic started to close things because with the kids home and the uncertainty I wanted to make sure I could consistently run for my sanity. It’s easy to assemble and great for walking but if you get your run faster than a 7 it gets a little shaky. I would not recommend this model for runners wanting speed work or super long workouts but for an easy paced 3-5 miles it gets the job done without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea L Lahm

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great price
customer_reviews.text: I love this treadmill! It was delivered two days after I ordered it, and assembly was a breeze. Connecting the control cables goes a lot faster if you have two people, but I think it's doable with one person. The build quality is good, and the motor is really quiet. There are some preset programs, but I just use the speed up/down buttons - that's all I need to get a good workout. This is a great value for the price! **Update** After nearly a year of using it 45-60 minutes per day, 5-6 days per week, it still works as well as it did the day I got it. I’m very pleased with this treadmill!
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Good for fast walking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item. Mainly because of this pandemic so I didn’t want to spend a lot of money on a treadmill but I wish I did. It’s really affective at fast walking speeds but anything more than 4.2 mph it seems like it gets caught. I weight 145. My friends who weights 200, can’t go over 3.5 before it’s starts doing the same thing. If you’re looking for a light weight and easy set up for fast walking pace it’s perfect but anything for running, I wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Feikis

customer_reviews.title: Black screen
customer_reviews.text: Screen turns black. Does anyone’ know how to contact the seller? UPDATE After a month of almost daily use the band keeps moving to one side
customer_reviews.author: miriam zambrano

customer_reviews.title: Decent.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good simple treadmill, but at 100miles it goes into lube mode. You have to follow a procedure that I had to find online to turn off. Today though the roller bolts broke. Now I’m having a hard time acquiring the parts.
customer_reviews.author: enorym

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this treadmill in March, 2019 and after the first time using it the lube light came on and I was never able to clear it . The speed slowed down. Now it has started speeding up then slowing down almost throwing me off several times. I can't use it anymore it is too dangerous. Of course they only give you support for 2 months which has now run out. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: sandal

customer_reviews.title: Lasted two years...
customer_reviews.text: and then it stopped working. I called the manufacturer and was told that these treadmills are "disposable" and that fixing it would cost half the value of the treadmill. I mean, sure... it's really inexpensive, and I used it daily, but it still should have lasted more than two years. Just thought people looking to buy this treadmill should know that this was the case.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nagy

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I love this treadmill. I wanted something to run indoors because my workout schedule is inconsistent and I feel safer inside. I am 5'4" and 125 and this suits me perfectly. It gets used at least 6 days a week and I have already run several half-marathons on it. You cannot beat this for the price! I've had it for 3 months now. We are buying another one for our summer home so I can run there too!
customer_reviews.author: jessica morgan

customer_reviews.title: Cute little treadmill for gentle home use.
customer_reviews.text: I got this treadmill this week. Easy to assemble Took 20-25mins max. It was a little tricky to get it out of the box due to tight packaging(which is needed for machine safety). It showed an E0 error. Then I facepalmed. I forgot the emergency stop magnetic block. (the red one). Then it worked smoothly. The space for bottle/remote/phone is minimal but workable. The treadmill is sturdy and does not wobble. I live in an apartment on the 4th floor with neighbors below and on the side. No complaints yet. It is relatively quiet. So far very happy about it. Will update the review after a few months of use
customer_reviews.author: ket

customer_reviews.title: BROKE AFTER LIGHT USE
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well for all of one month with very light use. Then, the track unwound itself despite frequent cleaning. I was unable to contact the manufacturer for repairs despite having a warranty. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: J. Hawthorne

customer_reviews.title: hardware was junk would not start very dirty poor quali
customer_reviews.text: bolts would not start thread insert in unit was crap i ran thread dies through to solve this issue, unit was very dirty it was never wiped down at factory deck was dry and nat lubricated as stated in manual moving this unit is terrible design is ridicules im putting sliders on the storage feet ,, ALSO book says to raise deck until you hear a click ,,,, this is laughable as it is just a plain old pin that you must pull back and insert in a random spot on frame ,,,, its not even a dedicated area just near a seam ,,, it cheap thats it and i would not recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.author: LaronVonBaron

customer_reviews.title: Good, cheap, basic treadmill
customer_reviews.text: Look, it's a $400 treadmill that is available and didn't break yet. That's more than I can say for almost anything at this price point right now. Assembly was made a bit harder do to having the bolt holes being drilled slightly wonky. The built in programs are kind of a joke. Honestly just download an app and set the speeds to your preferences for each section. It's a bare-bones starter treadmill. It goes up to 9mph. This is likely all you need if you are looking at your first treadmill. Incline is adjusted manually while the machine is off. It's not convenient, but it's not the end of the world.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Kurash

customer_reviews.title: Excessive Assembly Charge. No Real Incline Feature
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery of treadmill. ***Paid for assembly thinking it complicated since the charge was on the high side. (Assembly is FREE for most other equipment listed on Amazon) Ended up paying $135 for less than 30min of assembly time. Dissatisfied with the almost nonexistent incline feature on this treadmill. In any case, it works for now. Fine if you just want a basic treadmill. ***Will be asking for partial return of assembly fee.
customer_reviews.author: S.F.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at the beginning of coronavirus lock down assuming we’d use for two-three months. The price was so low we didn’t imagine it would last much longer than that. Well - we are six months in and LOVING this product. It is small, but not a problem for us. I’m 5’3 and my husband is 5’8. We had just run the LA marathon when lockdown began, so we use it to run long. My husband probably runs 20 miles a week on it at 7 or 8 speeds and I run 10 miles at 6 or 7 speeds. Also have taken to walking on it now that summer is here and it’s too hot outside. Cannot recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Falcone

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. I did a lot of research before deciding to buy this product and was so excited to get it. I have had this treadmill for less than one month, running on it for 20-30minutes every day (speed 5-6.5), and every time I run on it, the entire screen leaks ink so I cannot see the distance, time or anything. It’s VERY annoying. Considering the times we’re in, I am hesitant to return because the gyms are still closed, but this is very unfortunate. It’s going to be a big hassle to return and wait for a new one. If you can avoid this issue, please do! Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Carla S

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I were looking for a treadmill that was not bulky, but still study and could do the job. The assembly was not difficult; however, when we first tried to run it, nothing happened. We kept getting an error indicating that the wiring or connections were not complete. We contacted Amazon, who in turn contacted the manufacturer. They responded in a timely way and were able to coach me through opening the motor cover and discovering that a wire had become disconnected. I plugged it in, and we were off and running (pun intended!) The treadmill is serving us very well.
customer_reviews.author: Geniel Childs

customer_reviews.title: the screen does not work turn black sometime
customer_reviews.text: the screen does not work turn black sometimes when you push the buttons to increase the speed
customer_reviews.author: Jose Luis Prado

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT jog! Dangerous! Stops abruptly when it does turn on.
customer_reviews.text: Negative stars if possible! Does not work! Waste of time and money! I purchased this treadmill so that I could get some exercise during this quarantine. Took 1-2 hours to put together (alone). It’s heavy and not all the screws went into place easily. The first time I used it, it shut off abruptly once. Second time I tried turning it on, it wouldn’t turn on right away. I checked the plug, the safely thing and kept switching it on/off. It finally came to life but then it continued to stop without warning every 1-3 mins. Do NOT try jogging! Dangerous! I almost feel a couple of times trying it at different speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Georgie

customer_reviews.title: Functionality / ease of assembly & Operation .
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived on time & in good condition . I've only had this for 1 day , but it was relatively easy to assemble & operate. Most of these machines are made overseas (Mostly China) & as such do not always have clear instructions. The instructions were clear & had plenty of pictorials to help make assembly easy. It also has just the right amount of features - 10 different programs plus a manual override mode. No Bluetooth or Heart rate monitor - I don't need a physical - I just want to walk & jog on my new treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Clocker

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My treadmill was not even a year old and is broke E2 kept coming up called today they asked me if I lucubrate it I told them I do and they said it can be the controller and a the belt which would cost $250. I paid $304 for it. The warranty is only good for 90 days. How can it burn out so fast? Do not waste your money on this brand buy another one! Stanford the service manger is a joke. Would not help at all was very arrogant asked him for his mangers name would not give it.
customer_reviews.author: tina

customer_reviews.title: No problems thus far
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate the size of this treadmill as I didn't want to give up too much space in my spare bedroom. I have ran about 70 miles on it so far with no issues to note. I was worried the belt would be too narrow but it has been a non-issue. Would recommend for someone wanting to get into running. -Bryan (6ft - 170lbs)
customer_reviews.author: Marianne Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Exactly the treadmill I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I just got this treadmill today. Put it together all by myself, and I am 62. Not sure how I got this 108 pound box into my apartment, took it out of the box, and put it together. My hip was out of place from an injury 3 days earlier and was hurting very badly. (Actually, my hip feels better now, believe it or not!) Since I'm so badly out of shape, I only spent about 17 minutes on it. That's a start! Works great so far!! I am very impressed with this machine!!
customer_reviews.author: Bridges2012

customer_reviews.title: Not much of an incline
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit disappointed. I guess you do get what you pay for. The "incline" feature is a manual incline (if you can call it an incline at to all). Not really worth the trouble it takes to make it incline. Wish I had spent a little more money and bought something with better features for tracking my progress and for programming individual work outs. It comes with pre-programmed workout but they aren't great. It does the job. I can walk or run inside now during bad weather but, like I said, if I had to do it over again I would spend a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: If it seems loud, oil and check that the belt is placed correctly
customer_reviews.text: Walking barefoot and with shoes and it does seem kind of loud. Not sure as I have never owned a treadmill before. Edit: I needed to adjust the belt! It’s very quiet now.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Should be able to adjust the height of the handle bars. When running at high speeds, belt slides left and right, creating friction. No instructions provided for oiling the belt or troubleshooting the computer. Size is great, feels sturdy. Bolts come lose with use, must keep the wrench handy. No holes provided for ice water. 1-9 number system makes it easy to adjust exact speeds during use. Overall a very practical machine, would recommend for people with running in mind. Comes with no extra luxuries and requires regular inspection and maintenance. Definitely not useful for commercial purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel H.

customer_reviews.title: E4 error straight out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Like a few others I got the E4 error code upon powering this thing on the first time. According to the manual this means the "motor is not connected properly or not connected to the controller". I removed the hood covering the motor and board and found that one of the wires from the motor had disconnected from the board. There are only 2 wires, 1 red, one black. I simply reconnected the black wire and that was it, problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: lapoola

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after reading reviews. Initially looking for a higher priced model. However we bought this model and couldn't be more pleased. It was a snap to set up-about 20 minutes. So far it is working flawlessly. Couldn't be happier with purchase. Don't waste your money on an expensive tread mill. This one will fill your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Dan & Robin

customer_reviews.title: Great treadmill for the price
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted to start with something basic to see if I would actually use it. I must say this treadmill works great and is perfect for the first time buyer. Easy to use and nice walking surface. Downfall is that there is no electronic incline feature. Still for the price it exceeds ex[expectations. it is nice being able to walk through the winter months without having to worry about snow, ice and cold. I also like the smaller footprint as I didn't have a lot of room
customer_reviews.author: Tumeria

customer_reviews.title: It's in my office...  Other than my Fitbit, this is the best Health Investment I have ever made!
customer_reviews.text: Other than my Fitbit, this treadmill is the best Health Investment I ever made! I researched all these fancy $3-4K machines and saw all the bells and whistles, but this is all I need. It's right near my desk. I have a tv in my office and i can watch the news and walk at the same time. I can listen to a conference call and walk at the same time. This will change my life, and I was going down hill with medical challenges. I am going to beat this, but I won't have the worry of a huge payment at the same time. $300 bucks! it took 20 minutes to slip together. 2 works best.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly Belle

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: The biggest hurdle of having a treadmill is space but the TR150 folds very easily. If you do not have the expertise, I would advise to definitely get an expert for assembly. I find the preset speed settings on the TR150 very helpful but I wish it had more of an incline. It has been over a year now and I am pretty happy with its performance. Customer Service at Xterra is very good and responsive. I recently reached out for support and Shane was very helpful in solving my problem. Thanks Shane!
customer_reviews.author: rayhan

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: Listen, is this thing going to last you a lifetime? Probably not. However it’s a great deal for the money, and perfect for the Covid19 quarantine. My best friend recently purchased a beautiful Nordictrack but it set her back $4500. For $360 I’m very happy. I was a little worried reading some of the reviews but I have been very impressed. Granted I have only had it a little over a week. My hope is that it lasts a couple years. It’s the perfect size for my office. It’s not top quality like something you’d see at a gym but I am very happy considering what I paid
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for "E6" Error Code (Controller Component Failure)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this treadmill as a gift and it has had very little use. After finally deciding to using it, I get an E6 error code 10 minutes into a 3.5 mph run. User manual states it's a controller malfunction and thier solution/cause is controller component failure (Not helpful at all manufacturer!). I recommend to those looking at this product to find a better product that will actually last.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Needs a new motor controller
customer_reviews.text: 9 months after purchasing this treadmill It stopped working and gave an e8 error. I called the manufacturer who said an e8 is basically the same as an e6 error, and that the treadmill would need a new motor controller. The parts only have a 90-day warranty. The cost of a new motor controller is $120 with $12 shipping. That's about half the cost of what I paid for the treadmill. Amazon was no help...don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I was able to unbox and put this together by myself. It isn't fancy, but I just wanted a basic treadmill for walking, and this one has worked great for me. I like the shelf for holding my tablet. I don't particularly enjoy walking, so I'd rather watch Netflix than watch my progress.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this treadmill in May. I’ve been extremely busy with work and used it only a few times. At first it was good. Now, I’m ready to start using it again, and of course something is wrong with it. No matter how much we adjust the belt, it leans to the left side causing a loud noise. I tried to contact customer service for this manufacturer, and they have yet to respond. Honestly, they can take it back because I paid nearly $400 and I can’t even use it. I am so annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Warranty Service
customer_reviews.text: The Treadmill came factory failed, with a belt problem that made a lot of noise when used. I contacted the manufacturing company, spoke to Stanford the Technical Support Supervisor and they sent me a new treadmill in just a few days. They solved the problem quickly and without complications.
customer_reviews.author: Peque

customer_reviews.title: Space saver and durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few months ago and waited on reviewing until I got a good use out of it. Well this has been amazing and probably the best thing I’ve ever purchased. I enjoy how of space saver this is. It looks elegant too and I use it daily to get in a good 3 mile walk! I highly recommend this for someone who wants to be able to get an at home moderate exercise in.
customer_reviews.author: Ren

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Easy to put together.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great treadmill for the money or other wise. Brother and mother love it. Simple to use and the pre set programs are great. This is a EASY do it yourself put together. As long as you can pick up 50 lbs. One platform, two bars,one top piece and 12 screws that comes with a allen wrench/ hex key. I put it together myself. From carton ( removal is the hardest part) to walking on it 30 minutes. Definitely highly recommend .
customer_reviews.author: gldtobfl

customer_reviews.title: I actually use it!
customer_reviews.text: The fact that I am actually using this treadmill is testimony enough to how great it is. It works smoothly, quietly, and does exactly what it's supposed to. I don't run on it so I can't speak to that and the incline is fine for me. I'm getting my steps in each day and that's what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer K.

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked at how easy this was to put together. I am almost 60 and my daughter who is 18 gave me a hand and we did it in under an hour. It’s a nice machine but the incline is very low. Also the top shakes when you get into a full run unless you hold onto the side rails. All And all for the price it was worth the money. Not to mention the convenience of being able to pay monthly. I just needed to be able to exercise 30 minutes a day not trying out for the Olympics or anything so it’s perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra R

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage, bad idea ordering it. It's a prime item but took nearly a month to arrive after Amazon kept telling me it would be here the next day. Nothing works properly, it was a mistake picking this one.
customer_reviews.author: Morbit W.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I received it yesterday, so my review may change after some time. Was a breeze to put together. Easy to fold and put away. Tracked the correct miles that I ran. It did arrive cracked at the front of the treadmill, but it so far hasn't effected its functionality. The worst part of the treadmill is the smell. I would recommend leaving the windows open after unboxing and putting it together. There is still a faint smell, but I am sure it will go away here soon.
customer_reviews.author: Reebie

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY KEEP SEARCHING
customer_reviews.text: I bought this two weeks ago I’m going to be honest it sucks When I run on it makes a horrible scratchy/squeaky noise I feel like it’s gonna blow up on me! I weight 130 not reason for the machine to act like it’s going to blow up Read really carefully the package says “cancer hazardous” Why sell a product that may produce cancer??? Overall I feel like it’s cheap and I should’ve went with a better choice and I should’ve paid the price next time I’m aiming for something more expensive and better quality
customer_reviews.author: Lulu992

customer_reviews.title: Walker
customer_reviews.text: This was the easiest treadmill to put together. We are 75 years young and it took us under 2 hours from opening the package, assembling and clean up the cardboard. On the downside the string on my safety key is frayed, not sure what to do with it.
customer_reviews.author: gloria b

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together. I am so pleased as this was my biggest worry lol, but it literally only had a few washers/screws that were to be attached with an Allen wrench. It runs great, folds easily and is just as good quality as the $800 I used to have.
customer_reviews.author: Keri

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price  but noisey
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I'll update review after 6 months. I use it 45 minute 3 times a week. My only complaint is that it is noisy. And I mean good thing I listen to music so I dont have to hear the treadmill But for the price so far its decent. I wish I could control the volume everytime I change the settings. I've had it for about 45 days now. So if anything changes I'll update it is easily foldable but doesnt fold perfectly straight
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: No lights on console.
customer_reviews.text: Great, if you just want a very basic treadmill, I have this a 2 start because, no lights on the console. Also, the product came with an extra bag of hardware, nuts, 4 inch bolts, 2 metal pieces, that are not included in the manual. The first set was correct hardware. However, it is not a quiet unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: XTERRA Fitness TR150 Folding Treadmill Black
product_meta.description: The XTERRA Fitness TR150 Treadmill combines the quality and performance you desire with the flexibility of a machine that can be easily folded up and stored away.
feature_bullets: Large 5 inch LCD display is easy to read and keeps you updated on speed, incline, time, distance, calories, and pulse
Speed range 0. 5 -10 MPH allows for users of all fitness levels.Pull the knob to release the deck to fold or unfold
12 preset programs offer unmatched variety for your workouts
3 Manual incline settings allow for maximum variety. Side rails: plastic. Belt: 1 ply, 1. 4mm
Prop 65: this product can expose you to chemicals including toluene and acrylamide which are known to the state of California to cause cancer, birth defects, or other reproductive harm.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
